div.div: Nothobranchius furzeri and the daily schedule during the observation period.
div.p: (A, B) Conspicuously colored N. furzeri males, red and yellow morph respectively, and (C) female N. furzeri. (photographs by Arnout F. Grégoir). (D) Fish were kept at a 14 h: 10 h day:night regime (light period from 7am–9pm). Red arrows indicate the administration of live food ( Chironomus larvae). Shaded boxes indicate the three daily sample bursts. Time of day is indicated for the light period.
